page.title: 07KNOCKERDOWN INN RECREATION
page.content: Outside there is a large car park and a beer garden where families are welcome. This is frequented by the Inn's 3 ducks and 2 drakes which live in the field next door. There are 5 1/2 acres of land attached to the Inn and this is sub-let for grazing sheep. Also every September a{Folk Festival} is held here. The{customers}to the Inn are mainly middle-aged as there is no fruit machine or juke box. Many are farmers or passing visitors to the area. There is no walk-in trade. The pub relies heavily on Summer trade. The Inn has a{Tug of War team} which competes in the Derby Winter League. The building is part centrally-heated and there is a real fire in the bar lounge using coal, anthracite and logs.
